-| wi(wcel(cuni(c0), con0), wcel(csuc(cuni(c0)), ctop))
body.pretty:
⊢ (Ord(c0)→(c0 ≠ ⋃ c0 → c0 ∈ Top))
⊣ (⋃ c0 ∈ On → suc(⋃ c0)∈ Top)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(word(c0), wb(wcel(c0, ctop), wne(c0, cuni(c0))))
-| wi(wcel(cuni(c0), con0), wcel(csuc(cuni(c0)), ctop))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (Ord(c0)→(c0 ∈ Top ↔ c0 ≠ ⋃ c0))
⊣ (⋃ c0 ∈ On → suc(⋃ c0)∈ Top)

comment: An ordinal is a topology iff it is not its supremum (union), proven without the Axiom of Regularity. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 1-Nov-2015.)
